result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Custody-Beyond Visitation, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in civil judgment.
- Restitution set at ZERO.
Consecutive to: consecutive to 16CF1694, credit for 170 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - No contact with victim T.T. and C.P., unless approved by the agent.

- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications, comply with any recommended treatment.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent
- Provide a DNA sample.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
- No contact with firearms.
-  Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Eugene Perkins

records.addlTxt:
Per Remittitur Dated June 10, 2020, Appeal Nos.  2018AP002057-CRNM (2016CF000043), 2018AP002058-CRNM (2016CF001694), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on April 28, 2020, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney  Diane Lowe is relieved of any further representation of  Anthony Eugene Perkins in these appeals. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
per order dated April 28, 2020, Appeal Nos. 2018AP2057-CRNM (2016CF43) and 2018AP2058-CRNM (2016CF1694), IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Diane Lowe is relieved from further representing Anthony Eugene Perkins in these appeals. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State complied with victim notification. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 YEARS, consecutive to 16CF1694, credit for 170 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications, comply with any recommended treatment.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim T.T. and C.P. unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge to be paid from prison funds in the amount found appropriate, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Branch 24 in trial. Case heard off the record. Case adjourned to branch 24 Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Consulting Psychologist Report.
Examining Psychologist Report, Filed

Defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Eugene Perkins in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State withdrew their offer to the defendant. Case set for Jury Trial on 8-22-2016 8:30 am. Case adjourned to Branch 24.

Matter is scheduled for status conference today.  State's motion to increase bail argued and GRANTED by the Court. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
